item.title: How To Negotiate Closing Costs Without Losing Your Lender
item.description: Closing costs can add thousands of dollars to your mortgage transaction, and most borrowers either accept them blindly or push back so aggressively that they damage the lender relationship. The truth sits in the middle: many fees are negotiable, but the way you negotiate determines whether your specialist stays motivated to close your loan on time. Here is how to identify which costs you can reduce, what leverage you actually have, and how to frame the conversation so everyone wins.

item.title: The Hidden Costs of Using Your Current Bank for a Mortgage: What They're Not Telling You
item.description:
“You’ve been with us for 15 years—of course we’ll take care of you on your mortgage.”

That’s what the banker told my neighbor when she applied for a home loan. She trusted them. She’d had checking, savings, a car loan, and two credit cards with them since college. Surely they’d reward that loyalty with a great mortgage deal, right?

They quoted her 6.75% on a conventional loan with $2,900 in lender fees. She accepted it without question because “they know me and my finances.”
